intro: Galium multicaule var. eriophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
